title: SiriusXM orders pair of satellites to expand in Canada and Alaska
summary: SiriusXM said Nov. 29 it has ordered two more satellites from Maxar Technologies to expand its radio broadcasting constellation.

title: U.S. Space Command supports use of ‘responsive launch’ to deter China and Russia
summary: Gen. James Dickinson, head of U.S. Space Command, said the U.S. military should take advantage of commercially available launch options and vehicles that can operate from multiple locations

title: UK firm to release GEO-compatible smartphone early next year
summary: British handset maker Bullitt said Nov. 29 it will release a smartphone early next year capable of sending and receiving texts via satellites in geostationary orbit.

title: Pentagon report: China’s space strategy shaped by technological change
summary: The Pentagon in its 2022 report on China's military capabilities says the PLA continues to develop weapons for use against satellites in orbit

title: NASA to Cancel GeoCarb Mission, Expands Greenhouse Gas Portfolio
summary: NASA announced Monday it intends to cancel development of its GeoCarb mission, and instead implement a plan for pursuing alternate options to measure and observe greenhouse gases.

title: Amazon used AWS on a satellite in orbit to speed up data analysis in ‘first-of-its kind’ experiment
summary: Amazon’s cloud computing division successfully ran a software suite on a satellite in orbit, in a “first-of-its-kind” experiment, the company announced Tuesday.

title: South Korean leader eyes “landing on moon in 2032, Mars in 2045”
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said Nov. 28 that the country will land a robotic spacecraft on the moon in 2032 and on Mars in 2045.

title: NASA, ICON Advance Lunar Construction Technology for Moon Missions
summary: As NASA plans for long-term human exploration of the Moon under Artemis, new technologies are required to meet the unique challenges of living and working on another world.

title: China finishing busy Space station year with Shenzhou-15
summary:
China has launched the Shenzhou-15 mission to the Tiangong space station on Tuesday, Nov. 29, during an instantaneous launch window at 15:08 UTC from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center (JSLC).

It launched three taikonauts to the station to replace the current crew of the Shenzhou-14 mission, using a Chang Zheng 2F (CZ-2F) rocket and launching from Space Launch Site 1 (SLS-1), which is also known as Site 901.

title: Orion flies far beyond the Moon, returns an instantly iconic photo
summary: "It’s really hard to articulate what the feeling is."
